publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2710# Colin Campbell: Establishment of Task Force for the Regeneration of Inverclyde-That the Parliament notes with concern the Registrar General's prediction of decline in the population of Inverclyde between 2001 and 2016, the highest predicted depopulation of Scotland's 32 council areas; recognises that a main cause of this depopulation is lack of job opportunities; believes that this decline places an intolerable burden on the remaining population in terms of council tax and service delivery, and considers that the Scottish Executive should establish a task force with the resources to address the problems facing Inverclyde, with a view to reversing decline through regeneration and restoring prosperity. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Christine Grahame*, Andrew Wilson*, Ms Sandra White*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Fiona McLeod*, Kay Ullrich*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Shona Robison*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Bruce Crawford*, Michael Russell*
S1M-2710# Establishment of Task Force for the Regeneration of Inverclyde (lodged on 6 February 2002) Fergus Ewing*
